column4: I screwed mine up and haven't been able to find anyone that is using 6.06
I just need a default adduser.conf to past into mine ... with the hopes of fixing what I messed up.
you could download the source for !adduser and extract the default adduser.conf
except that I'm a newbie and don't know how ... sorry
at a terminal --  apt-get source adduser
that would download the source and extract it into the current folder
root@lampsrv:/home# apt-get source adduser
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Need to get 190kB of source archives.
Get:1 http://us.archive.ubuntu.com dapper/main adduser 3.80ubuntu2 (dsc) [651B]
Get:2 http://us.archive.ubuntu.com dapper/main adduser 3.80ubuntu2 (tar) [189kB]
never paste in here
you still here?
yeah
I just did this:  aptitude install source adduser  ... and it appears to have done something
sec
nice ... "aptitude install source adduser" from the /etc directory fixed my problem!
Thanks guys, I gotta go get my kids to bed
l8r
yes, it seems to have downloaded the source -- add user is at - adduser-3.103ubuntu1/examples/adduser.local.conf.examples/adduser.conf
what you did there was reinstall adduser -- and you could have done that from anywhere -- not just in /etc
